title.narrative: PROMUNDO "Young men clubs against violence in Kinshasa"

description.narrative:
PROMUNDO "Young Men Clubs against violence in Kinshasa", 2015-2019, 28 MSEK
Insatsen syftar till att adressera negativa former av maskulinitet hos pojkar och unga män i Kinshasa i Demokratiska Republiken Kongo (DRK). PROMUNDO och dess lokala samarbetspartners kommer att arbeta med våldsprevention genom att förhindra att pojkar och unga män i åldern 10-19 år ansluter sig till gatugäng (s.k. kulunas) samt bistå de som redan anslutit sig att ta sig ur negativa spiraler av våld. Programmet kommer att vara aktivt i skolor och ungdomscentra såväl som på högre nivåer med utvalda institutioner och departement. Projektet kommer att vara aktivt i tre kommuner i Kinshasa - Kintambo, Bumbu och Makala.
Projektet är utformat för att ge stöd till pojkar och unga män som växer upp i urbana områden med hög våldsprevalens för att engagera dem som förändringsagenter för en ökad jämställdhet. Nyckelaktiviteter inkluderar evidensbaserad gruppundervisning för att uppmuntra unga män att kritiskt reflektera och diskutera sin situation och sin roll i samhället. Kampanjer för att medvetandegöra såväl unga som allmänheten kommer att genomföras i de tre utvalda kommunerna.
Insatsen kommer att genomföras i samarbete med följande organisationer: - Réseau des Educateurs des Enfants et Jeunes de la Rue en République Démocratique du Congo (REEJER), ett kongolesiskt nätverk av frivilligorganisationer som arbetar med gatubarn; - Aide à L'Enfance Defavorisée (AED), en organisation som driver ungdomsgårdar i Kinshasa; - Coalition Nationale pour l'Education en RDC (CONEPT), ett nätverk av utbildare i det kongolesiska skolsystemet; samt - Institut Supérieur du Lac (ISL), ett institut för högre utbildning i psykisk hälsa.
Programmet kommer att genomföras i fem överlappande faser: i) forskning, ii) metodutveckling, iii) implementering, iv) utvärdering och v) påverkansarbete.

The Young Men Clubs Against Violence (YMCAV) is a proposed four-year project aimed at preventing and responding to urban violence perpetrated by the Kuluna street gangs - developed by PROMUNDO and the Living Peace Institute. The project will tackle street violence by preventing young men and boys (ages 10-19) from joining, as well as helping them leave, the local street gangs – the Kulunas - in three municipalities in Kinshasa (Kintambo, Bumbu and Makala) which are increasingly affected by such gangs. To this aim, the project will encourage positive youth development by building life skills and positive coping mechanisms for young men and boys in schools and youth centers for “street children.”
The project is designed to provide support to young men and boys who are growing up in high urban violence settings while also engaging them as agents of change. The proposed project serves as both primary and secondary prevention measures and will address physical as well as psychological violence. Key project activities will include evidence-based group education to encourage young men’s critical reflection on the problem of violence while strengthening their coping mechanisms to avoid it; the creation of positive peer groups (i.e. youth clubs and school/youth centers); and youth-led community campaigns. Such activities are inspired by PROMUNDO’s past work with young men (Program H ) and with men affected by trauma and violence in post-conflict and high-violence settings (Living Peace). Simultaneously, the capacities of key NGO networks working in schools and/or doing outreach to “street children” in the community will be strengthened.

sector.narrative: Ending violence against women and girls

tag.narrative: 16.1 - Avsevärt minska alla former av våld och dödligt våld överallt.
16.1 - Significantly reduce all forms of violence and related death rates everywhere.
5.2 - Avskaffa alla former av våld mot alla kvinnor och flickor i det offentliga och privata rummet, inklusive människohandel, sexuellt utnyttjande och andra typer av exploatering.
5.2 - Eliminate all forms of violence against all women and girls in the public and private spheres, including trafficking and sexual and other types of exploitation.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The second half of 2017 and 2018 constituted the period intensive implementation. There is indication that the project reached its momentum in early 2018 with up to 48 young men clubs set up. Campaign activities have taken place in schools and youth centers to sensitize and inform school staff, students, parents and guardians, and local police about the problems associated with young and adolescent boys’ (10-19) involvement in violent groups. The authorities have been properly involved in the project. Additional municipalities in Kinshasa have adopted the young men's club approach as a working modality in preventing youth from joining violent groups. This adoption is an example of a major unexpected result. There are still a few challenges which need to be monitored. The most important one concerns the chances for Promundo and its partners to achieve the targeted number of YM clubs. If the project realized 48 clubs in two years time, it is unlikely that 360 will be set up by the end of the project. Another concern is related to the poorimplication of the police officers as facilitators, as well as linking the project with other relevant activities (income generation for instance). Most importantly, gender aspects have been recognized to be poorly addressed. A recommendation from the Embassy has been that the project considers supporting the creation of clubs for girls at risk of joining similar groups (or that have left such groups). In this respect, the project's work plan for 2019 has targeted setting up 49 young girls groups.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
